issue.title: Fix docs URL in unregistered marks warning message

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for submitting a PR, your contribution is really appreciated!

Here is a quick checklist that should be present in PRs.

- [ ] Include documentation when adding new features.
- [ ] Include new tests or update existing tests when applicable.
- [X] Allow maintainers to push and squash when merging my commits. Please uncheck this if you prefer to squash the commits yourself.

If this change fixes an issue, please:

- [ ] Add text like ``closes #XYZW`` to the PR description and/or commits (where ``XYZW`` is the issue number). See the [github docs](https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-your-work-on-github/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword) for more information.

Unless your change is trivial or a small documentation fix (e.g., a typo or reword of a small section) please:

- [ ] Create a new changelog file in the `changelog` folder, with a name like `<ISSUE NUMBER>.<TYPE>.rst`. See [changelog/README.rst](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/main/changelog/README.rst) for details.

  Write sentences in the **past or present tense**, examples:

  * *Improved verbose diff output with sequences.*
  * *Terminal summary statistics now use multiple colors.*

  Also make sure to end the sentence with a `.`.

- [ ] Add yourself to `AUTHORS` in alphabetical order.
-->
Fixes #8787

Fix URL of documentation link in message of warning issued on unregisterd marks from https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/mark.html (broken link) to https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/how-to/mark.html.

body:
@The-Compiler, can I help with this?

Do you know which PR(s) restructured the docs? That would speed-up finding the new link values.

See the [PRs by @evildmp](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/pulls?q=is%3Apr+author%3Aevildmp+is%3Aclosed) on this - I think it was mostly #8433, but probably others as well.

Having a list of how the documentation moved certainly would be a good starting point, then we could also add redirects to fix existing links (see #8471).

However, I suppose it's not always that easy, as one page (in the old docs) typically got split into three (in the new docs). For example, should the old [fixture docs](https://docs.pytest.org/en/6.2.x/fixture.html) now redirect to:

- [The fixtures how-to](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/how-to/fixtures.html)
- [The fixtures explanation](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/explanation/fixtures.html)
- [The fixtures reference](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/reference/fixtures.html)

It's tricky, and I wish we'd have given this more consideration when restructuring those docs...

I'm also wondering if changing all those links is really the right approach, or we should go for a different solution. I'll post over in #8471 about that one. Let's try to get to a consensus there, and then maybe you can help with that, if that works for you?

issue.title: Redirect old doc pages to new locations

labels.name: type: docs
labels.description: documentation improvement, missing or needing clarification

labels.name: type: removal
labels.description: marks the actual removal of a feature, usually done in major releases

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
As part of the docs restructuring #8443 some pages are moved, so the old URLs now return 404. Some of these pages have a lot of incoming links so I think it's important to keep them working.

First we need to create a list of pages we want to keep working (TODO).

Then we need to implement the redirects. I think there are two ways to go about that:

1. HTTP redirects - requires server configuration. Looks like ReadTheDocs [can do it](https://docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-defined-redirects.html).
2. HTML redirects - requires placeholder pages with `<meta refresh>`. Can use a [sphinx plugin](https://pypi.org/project/sphinx-reredirects/) to do it or implement one ourselves. 

I think server redirects are easier and more recommended. I can add them unless someone objects (I would need permissions for RTD though).

body:
> Let's try to get to a consensus there, and then maybe you can help with that, if that works for you?

Sure!

issue.title: Adjust doc links for new scheme

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Closes #8831 and supersedes #8830.

Some notes:

1) Since we have redirects in place now (#8471), we don't strictly need to do this (except for a couple of cases where the contents moved, I'll comment on those below). However, I still think it's good if we point to the "canonical" location of the docs.
2) Those links won't work right now, unless you replace `/stable/` by `/latest/`. They will however work once 7.0 is released and RTD regenerates the stable docs.

I'd probably hold off merging this shortly before the 7.0 release (perhaps even the final one rather than the prerelease?) so that we don't break links for people trying the rc or running from git before 7.0 is out.

cc @DrGFreeman

body: Reopening this given that we're starting to revert those changes (#8929, #8945)... Will need another pass shortly before the release.

issue.title: Revert "Fix Dead link in README for 'assert statements' "

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
This reverts commit 15989ddc8f20e49602858e6e4a2631b71e8b9ef1.

Reverts #8945, thus reintroducing #8926 temporarily, but we should be close to
the 7.0.0 release now, where this is the correct URL to use.

Closes #8831 as follow-up to #8858.
